runs.comm: starts off with a slower ball, no-ball on middle as Shehzad is able to clip this to midwicket, with Sharjeel Khan to take the free hit
looking for the yorker again but gets this to swing down the leg side, with Sangakkara doing well to hold on to the ball
zeroing in on leg stump as Sharjeel works this away to mid-on
on a fuller length and swinging into Sharjeel as the ball hits his front pad, with the batsmen running a bye
slower ball on a length as Shehzad gets early into his shot, looking to work this one away to the leg side. Malinga appeals but can see the ball inside-edging there, so more hopeful than anything
another slower ball on a length as Shehzad is able to pick a single on the leg side
another inswinging yorker to the left-hander, this time just outside off, as the ball tails in to beat the bat, and almost shave the off stump, on the way to the keeper
gets this to shape in on a length outside off as Shehzad is surprised by this one as he gets it away to the leg side
swinging wildly away from the left-hander as the umpire straight away calls a wide. Looked like Sharjeel had backed away there to create room on the off side

on the pads and Sharjeel times this sweetly off the pads down to deep midwicket, with deep square leg coming round and diving on the full to stop this from hitting the rope. Excellent fielding effort by Thirimanne
waits on the back foot before guiding this straight to point
length ball outside off as Shehzad slaps this to point, with Dilshan making an acrobatic stop, diving to his right to stop this in its track
Sri Lanka's fielders really want this victory as Senanayake dives at mid-off to cut off Shehzad
Sharjeel simply lofts Kula back over his head as there is enough width on offer to get this down to the long-off boundary

gets this to drift to the off side as Shehzad is invited for the drive, with the ball just beating the edge. Kumar snaps up the offering and immediately stumps him, going for a loud appeal. Third umpire has been brought in to adjudge, and it looks like he just had his foot behind the crease when the bails were whipped off. Ruled not out ultimately
too full and Shehzad just lasers this through extra-cover, almost as if to vent his frustration, as it was hit at a rate of knots

pitching a juicy offering on middle as Shehzad looks to sweep this round the corner, but hits it straight to Kulasekera at backward point, who does well to take a low catch. Pakistan lose their first wicket.
shorter one which is helped off the pads by Hafeez as he manages to get off the mark straightaway
floats this on middle as Sharjeel advances down, looking to hammer this over long-off again, but can't get it away
once again looking for the big shot, this time on the leg side, as Sharjeel mistimes this down to long-on, running hard enough to complete two
in the slot and Hafeez drives this on the up through cover. Senanayake, coming in from mid-off, fails to hold onto it as it goes all the way to the extra-cover boundary
fires a yorker in on middle which Hafeez does well to dig out
back of a length as Hafeez dances down the track in an attempt to put off Kula from his line, but the ball ends up cutting through him to the keeper, with Hafeez running hurriedly back to his crease

length ball going down the leg side as Hafeez hits this one uppishly through midwicket, avoiding the fielder at mid-on, who gets close but not close enough as it just dies on him. The pair are able to scamper back for two runs
hits this uppishly through midwicket, with the all dying on a diving mid-on, as the pair are able to scamper two
the pressure gets to Hafeez as he is undone by a ball that kept straight, but just tailed away from him at the last moment, with Kumar doing well to hold on to the deflection
flatter delivery outside off, Sharjeel comes down the track and slaps it to covers
tosses this up on a full length as Sharjeel manages to get this away off the back foot to mid-on
Maqsood drives this beautifully through the point region to get off the mark
tries to execute a classy back foot punch through the off side but finds the fielder
Maqsood fails to get away this leg side delivery, hitting it back to Senanayake
finishes off the over with a straighter one which surprises Maqsood, who ends up playing this away to the off side
back of a length and slanting into the hips of Sharjeel as he is stuck on the crease in two minds as to how to play this. Does get an inside-edge on to the top of his pads it seems
flat bats this slightly fuller delivery to midwicket for one
back of a length as Maqsood shuffles down to squeeze this away to the leg side for a single
this one heading down the leg side as Sharjeel looks to be positive on the leg side, but doesn't get a meaningful connection on it
Mathews being a tad predictable with this line as Sharjeel utilises his feet well to slap this away harshly through point for a boundary
tries a slower one but Sharjeel has all the time to pick the gap through third man and get this away to make it consecutive boundaries. Pakistan starting to roll here.
begins with a gentle toss up to Maqsood, who gets into position to loft this straight over the bowler's head for four
Dilshan changes to round the wicket, getting Maqsood to drive this one uppishly down to long-off
Sharjeel has the right intent but finds the fielder at long-off when he goes for the heave
Maqsood shuffling in his crease as he comes down to try and work this away to the leg side
slower ball that seems to hold up on Maqsood as he drives this down to long-on
Dilshan offers a lolly pop on middle and leg which Sharjeel accepts gleefully as he hoicks this over the midwicket boundary for a six
tries to work him away to the off side but finds the fielder
Maqsood doesn't want Prasanna to settle as he advances down to this full delivery to hit this straight back over the bowler's head
Maqsood once again trying to be cute as he goes down in an attempt to get this away to the leg side
flatter delivery from Prasanna which Maqsood fails to cut away on the off side
Maqsood doing well to use his feet to get this away to midwicket
straying down the leg side as Sharjeel helps this round the corner, past backward square leg, as the pair run hard to complete two
Maqsood punches him through the point region for a single
back of a length, leaving Sharjeel, as he glides this down to third man for a single
back of a length and Maqsood goes for it as he pulls this one straight up into the air, with Chandimal at midwicket holding on to a steepler
what a shot straightaway after the wicket as Sharjeel pulls this away, with a Greenidge-like finish, to the square leg boundary
tests him again with a shorter one and Sharjeel shows the previous shot was not a one-off as he is able to pull this fiercely behind square, all the way to the fine leg boundary
back of a length and coming in slightly as Sharjeel chops this one to the off side for a single
Sharjeel has come unhinged it seems as he just hammers this straight down the ground, just clearing the rope
Sharjeel is putting on a clinic as he slams this one over midwicket for an even bigger effort, met with cries of pleasure from the partisan crowd. 50 off 24 balls. Outstanding stuff.

and Prasanna has the final laugh as a low full toss, on leg stump, deceives Sharjeel, who had shuffled over to the leg side in an attempt to improvise, but ends up leaving his furniture exposed as the ball careens into the bottom of leg stump
Afridi able to work this away to long on for a quick single

Prasanna is showing the Sri Lankan selectors just what they were missing as he manages to bowl Umar Akmal, with the ball drifting in past the bat and onto the stumps. Two quick wickets have changed the very nature of the contest
almost gets himself caught-and-bowled first up as he drives this one uppishly back to Prasanna, who does get close to it, but the ball died on him
Afridi looked to hammer this one as he waited on the back foot, but instead plays this towards the off side for a single square off the wicket

floats this on off stump and Amin doesn't trouble the scorers much as he blitzes this straight to Chandimal at silly mid-off, taking his second catch of the innings. And he is not even the keeper today

going round the wicket, with the ball drifting across the batsman, as Bhatti leans forward in defense, but misses the line of the ball, with Sanga doing well to take the ball and stump him in rapid time as they go for the appeal. The third umpire is called in and it does appear that Bhatti was overbalancing with his foot on the crease. The decision is given out and Bhatti have now lost four wickets in seven balls
and it doesn't come to fruition as Tanvir gently drives this through mid-off
Afridi dances down and lasers this through sweeper cover, hitting it hard enough to beat a squarish third man to the boundary
again dances down in hopes of creating a shot, but ends up running this down to long-on
Prasanna bowls a truly rubbish ball (Rameez Raja said so) down the leg side as this one goes all the way for five wides
Afridi greets the new ball with a massive six over the long-on boundary. This one seemed to be in the air for an awfully long time
tosses this up, but gets the line wrong, as this one turns away wide of off stump
Afridi has decided he will go for it on his own as he shuffles down the track to clear the extra-cover boundary comfortably for another six
width on offer and Afridi just slaps this away over the inner ring for four
back of a length outside off as Afridi flays this to extra-cover for a single
Tanvir punches this one gently to the off side to get Mad Max back on strike
Afridi controls himself to play this one away to long-off and take the single that would allow him strike for the next over
outswinging yorker on and around off as Malinga seemingly lets this go past him in order for Afridi to be off strike. Genuinely looked to have removed his foot there.
low full toss, swinging into the batsman, as Tanvir clips this gently to midwicket
fuller delivery which is flicked uppishly through the leg side
in the slot but Tanvir simply drives this to extra-cover to get Afridi back on strike
yorker on middle and leg as Afridi works this away to the leg side
low full toss outside off as Tanvir blitzes this straight to point

what a catch from Sanga! really, what an amazing catch. Probably will go down in the annals of cricket this one as Afridi, in six-hitting mode, mishits a length ball from Perera which goes straight up into the air, swirling towards the slips. Sanga gets under it, calls it, but it looks as if he just overran it, but then at the very last moment stretches out his right glove to take a stunner. I mean it looked like it was all over, but he just manages to get a glove on it. Fantastic stuff this.
easy as a Sunday afternoon as Tanvir sticks his bat out to angle this behind him through fine leg
way too wide from Perera as the umpire shows the signal to the crowd
back of a length and Tanvir able to pull this in front of square, beating long-on to the boundary
slower, short ball that just leaves Tanvir as he looks to run this down to third man
back of a length and Ajmal able to help this along to get this wide of the fielder at fine leg for a well-timed boundary
slower delivery which is respected by Ajmal to see off the over
looking to help this one round the corner and is able to sneak a single after Lasith misfields at backward square leg
pitches this just outside off as Ajmal goes for the big sweep. The batsmen still able to run the leg bye
drags this one a bit as Tanvir just powers this over square leg, going all the way to make it six
pitched up on off as Tanvir is able to squirt this away for a single to the leg side
pitched up just outside off as Ajmal sensibly paddles this behind square on the leg side for a single
length ball which Tanvir again heaves over the leg side, but is unlucky in finding square leg, who after an initial misfield is able to fire in the return
yorker on off stump as Tanvir looks for a paddle-flick behind to fine leg
back of a length which is whipped off the pads by Ajmal for one
full and just outside off as Tanvir drills this straight to mid-off
tries him with a shorter one which has Ajmal stumbling as he tries in vain to duck under this
fires in a yorker on middle and leg, which Ajmal is able to get away to the off side, but ruled leg-bye by the umpire
full again outside off as Tanvir drives this hard to long-on
too full and wide and Tanvir lofts this over extra-cover for a boundary. Good start to the over for Pakistan

full again and this time Tanvir flicks over midwicket. With this one rising high enough that even the cameraman had trouble spotting it. This one flies over to deep midwicket, just landing inside the rope
full toss this time and Tanvir looks to hammer this over the leg side, but hits this straight to Chandimal, who runs backwards and dives with an outstretched left hand, but can't hold on to it
Ajmal flicks this slower one on middle and leg over midwicket, with the pair running hard enough to complete two
slower ball on off as Tanvir is able to guide this down to third man for a single
zeroing in on the pads as Tanvir is able to work this off his pads. Called no-ball by the umpire, so Pakistan are afforded an extra delivery, and more importantly, a free hit
shorter one going down the leg side and again he oversteps as fine leg completes the catch, but it didn't account for anything. We have another free hit on the cards

too full and shaping in as Tanvir is able to clear his front leg to heave this over midwicket, beating long-on to the rope. Malinga's over ends up giving up 20 runs. Really does struggle in the end overs, doesn't he?
fuller length ball outside off as Ajmal plays this straight to silly mid-off
length ball this time as Ajmal clubs this over midwicket to the waiting fielder
no one in the deep as Tanvir plays a pick-up shot to this full toss, over the leg side, but doesn't time it sweetly enough to get to the rope
another full toss and Tanvir hits this straight over long-on. His timing seems off now.
slower ball and this backfires in a huge way as Ajmal sees it early to slam this over the midwicket boundary for a huge six. Euphoria from the remaining Pakistan crowd.
low full toss and Ajmal has the presence of mind to paddle this over backward square leg, but can not beat fine leg
Malinga fires this one outside off and full as Tanvir reaches over in an attempt to lap this over fine leg, but can't get any bat on it
looking to bowl it full and wide in an attempt to curtail the runs but messes up the line as wide is called
much better from Malinga as he brings it slightly closer in, with Tanvir unable to get a connection on it
bang on target as Tanvir ends up hitting it back to Malinga. Excellent over thus far with just one from it

full and swinging on middle as Sri Lanka manage to prise the Big Wicket. Tanvir was looking to flick this through the leg side, but gets a leading edge which carries low to backward point, who takes a good catch. They are checking for the no-ball and it appears as though he had over-stepped, but he has got a little bit of his foot behind the line, so it should be given out. And the umpire confirms the decision as Tanvir walks off, but not before scoring a fine 41 at No. 9, the highest T20 score at that position. Wonderful effort from the left-armer

full and going down the leg side as Usman backs away in hopes of clearing this over the leg side. Sanga makes an excellent diving stop behind, and even goes for an appeal, but the umpire was not interested as it definitely bounced before it got to him
full an on the pads as Usman helps this down to fine leg for a single
yorker on target as Usman just squeezes this away to the leg side
slower bouncer which is called wide by the umpire as it clearly went over the batsman's head

delivers a slower ball on a length as Ajmal is early into his midwicket hoick, with the ball hitting the pads thereafter. The umpire could see the exposed stumps behind upon the moment of impact and raises the finger to dash Pakistani hopes
